etymology.description: pictogram: foot 止 with a leg/thigh on top; similar to 足; unrelated to the bottom of 是 (which is 止 on oracle bones).
etymology.interpretation: Originally depicts a leg above a foot, producing an image close to 足. It was later extended and borrowed as a measure word for bolts of cloth, while its resemblance to the lower part of 是 is accidental since that part derives from 止.

parts.english: to stop; pictograph of a foot

examples.chinese: 他买了一疋布(他買了一疋布)。
examples.pinyin: tā mǎi le yì pǐ bù.
examples.english: He bought one bolt of cloth.

examples.chinese: 市场上这种布按疋计价(市場上這種布按疋計價)。
examples.pinyin: shìchǎng shàng zhè zhǒng bù àn pǐ jìjià.
examples.english: In the market, this kind of cloth is priced by the bolt.

examples.chinese: 裁缝说还差半疋(裁縫說還差半疋)。
examples.pinyin: cáiféng shuō hái chà bàn pǐ.
examples.english: The tailor said we’re short by half a bolt.
